intro: Hermannia merxmuelleri, commonly known as the dwarf red hibiscus, is a compact, flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It produces striking, showy flowers with bright red petals and a yellow throat, typical of the Malvaceae family. The plant has small, narrow leaves that are arranged alternately along the stems. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Hermannia merxmuelleri is often cultivated as a ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and vibrant blooms.
